item.title: Investors Are Betting on a Market Melt-Up
item.description: They have flocked to stock funds at a pace rarely seen since 2008, but some are warning that shares look expensive historically.

item.title: For Retirees in Their 60s, the Move That Adds Years to a Nest Egg
item.description: Roth conversions allow retirees to pay taxes on their savings now, so that the money can grow tax-free in the future.

item.title: ‘I handle my dad’s finances’: My father is in a nursing home and will get $100K in compensation. What should I do with it?
item.description: “I’ve thought about CDs, money-market and mutual funds.”

item.title: ‘I’m 38 and completely broke’: I earn $50,000 a year. What professional degree will guarantee me six figures?
item.description: “I am willing to put in an extra 1 to 4 years of schooling and use student loans to pay for it.”

item.title: I juggle 18 credit cards. I would like to close 5 of them. How can I do this without ruining my credit score?
item.description: “I have very high limits, so charges barely make a blip on my credit-utilization ratio.”
